Generators go too quickly, with or without toolboxes, to play any killer that doesn't have map pressure. Playing clown is a living hell against any decent team.

Playing survivor in competent groups *still* breaks the game entirely, allowing them to sidestep the downsides of perks like object of obsession, and invalidate any other information perks outright.

Playing survivor alone will pit you against *your own team* as the game handholds survivors to such a degree that the game is flooded with players who don't understand certain parts of how the game works on extremely basic levels. 

Added onto this the number of players who only half try to win, as they don't care enough about a ranking system so mediocre that the devs decided they would break it *even more* (by changing how rank reset works) in order to justify the creation of an entirely new one....... which will take months to do and remain completely hidden even once it does arrive.

Maps have so many pallets that if you threw every single one in succession, and the killer doesn't give up chase, all generators would be finished and there would still be more.

A dozen or so survivor perks exist only as free "second chance" when they intentionally make a mistake in order to waste the killers time or reward them for making the dumbest plays possible: Borrowed time, deliverance, adrenaline, decisive*i-have-an-entire-minute-of-invulnerability-no-matter-how-the-killer-plays* strike, etc.

The game and the majority of recent changes are designed exclusively around the idea of getting new players into the game to spend some money on DLC, and not caring how long they stick around after they have. Casual player enjoyment is more important than those who have already cashed in and continue to play at a higher level despite rampant balance issues.
Great Game.  Questionable Balancing.

Fun game to play alone or with friends! As a killer main, I can NOT stand the constant circling that survivors do. But there are a few good ways to get around that. Just use your head, dont be stupid, and you may survive!

Don't play this for the sake of your own mental health. The toxicity in this game is ridiculous.

Solo survivor side: babies at high ranks, selfish players, trollers, body blockers, suiciders
Killer side: toxic survivors, bullies, gen rushers, traumatizable when you down a survivor, and after picking him/her up, you get blinded by flashlight, or someone sabotages a hook in front of your eyes

Basically, you can't escape toxicity playing a specific side. The game's hella fun, but the number of toxicity is just insane. There are also a lot of problems game has itself, but by end of the day, this game was ruined because of players.

[8-3-2022] Went from Not Recommended to Recommended, though just barely. They're doing a much better job addressing the game's issues which... you can probably guess why tho nothing is confirmed why they had a change of heart and suddenly cared again.

Bugs aren't as frequent anymore. Game balance is finally being addressed despite a few missteps and neglects. 

The biggest problem I have ATM isn't entirely on the devs, it's on the community. And no, not toxic behavior, I'm talking "escalation" since the game rebalance. People are overreacting to some of the changes made (not all, like I said there are a few missteps) and are now running anything to give themselves an easy win that wasn't touched, rather than enjoy what makes the game the most fun, chases.

Cheaters are now coming out of the woodwork. The ones that just do goofy stuff are ok, since it's good for a laugh, but the subtle cheaters are returning, as well as those that will literally hold a game hostage until the server shuts down after 2 hours. A lot of this is mostly against streamers and content creators, so if you're an average player you'll mostly just have to worry about subtle cheaters, and only at High MMR. A lot of this was thanks to BHVR releasing the game for free the 1st week of the EGS release, but I only assume so. Epic doesn't really give a flying fudge about cheaters.

I HIGHLY recommend this game! I bought it back in Dec '19 and it's the only game I want to play in my free time. Before I bought DbD I read a lot of comments about it being toxic, I disagree with those comments. I've played almost 3 months straight and I've only gotten 2 toxic experiences from people. That chat system is the best I've seen because it only allows before game and after game chat. No in game chat to distract you, which I really enjoy. There are a few bugs in game but not big enough that I want to stop playing. Being a horror lover makes it fun playing because each new "Killer" champion is someone from a horror show or movie. The only thing I'd change about this game is I wish they'd allow friends to queue up as killer AND survivor in real games. If I want to play with friends I strictly have to play survivor. I'd prefer the option for one of us to be able to queue in as Killer and the other as Survivor and be in the same game. Other than that, amazing game. Everyone should try it.

The game is a great asymmetrical horror game. It's a bit different than Friday the 13th with the objective being power the generators and escape the area. If you're into jump scares it's pretty solid when playing the survivor and you get to have the opportunity to play killers from classic horror/slasher movies. It's enjoyable although the community is a bit hit or miss. They can be toxic and being a killer is a lot harder than it seems. Also there is no in game voice chat so if you plan on using voice chat, find a discord server and some friends and hop on voice chat with them.

Es un buen juego con buena temática, constantes actualizaciones pero totalmente desbalanceado.
Si vas a jugar como superviviente te lo vas a pasar bien si juegas con amigos y es divertido a su forma, pero si vas a jugar de asesino el juego está totalmente desequilibrado, cuando consigas algo de nivel el que lo pasa mal es el killer y no los supervivientes, no podrás jugar con muchos asesinos si quieres pasartelo bien (matar a todos o hacer una buena partida) principalmente porque los supervivientes te pueden acabar la partida en 5 minutos a no ser que tengas algún asesino que pueda hacer una presión constante,  el matchmaking es horrible puedes tener una 400 horas y enfrentarte a un grupo de 4 surpervivientes con más de 2000 horas cada uno, los que deciden cuando y como acabar la partida son los supervivientes y no el killer,

В этой игре баланса нет практически вообще. Говорю как игрок с 240 часами, играю практически только на маньяках, Легион мейн. 
Если вы купили эту игру, чтобы поиграть на манах, то идите играть во что-то другое, но точно не это днище.
Писал на форумах, в тех поддержку, даже сам предлагал адекватные идеи для баффа Легиона, но разработчикам просто наср*ть на мнение киллер мейнов. Вот общие проблемы:
1. Выжившие просто нытики, которые ноют по любому проигрышу и просят занёрфить всё, что только можно.
2. От 1 пункта вытекает то, что все убийцы слабые, и из-за этого я покидаю dbd пока убийц не бафнут.
3. Разработчикам всё равно пофиг на этот коммент(ведь я Легион мейн как уже говорил).

Um game muito bom para se jogar com os amigos e fazer novas amizades! Possui alguns pequenos bugs, mas não atrapalha o jogo. Diversos personagens de sobreviventes e Killers com Perks variados para melhorar os seus personagens, com possibilidades de comprar perks para melhorias e etc.. DLCs pagas, por um pequeno valor, referente aos novos sobreviventes ou killers. O game entra na promoção várias vezes no valor de 18,00 reais. O ping depende do Host, que será o killer. Por isto existe uma barra identificando se o ping é alto, médio ou baixo, para você decidir se quer sair da sala e entrar em uma outra sala com um ping menor. Desta forma, o jogador é capaz de identificar se vale a pena ficar para jogar, para não atrapalhar a sua jogatina e dos outros players. O game é um pouco difícil para os sobreviventes (são 04) no total, mas com o tempo de jogo; conhecimento dos personagens; mapas e melhorias de personagens, o game fica bem mais fácil. É bom jogar com os amigos cooperativo, para obter o melhor êxito, pois existem jogadores novatos, alguns gostam de zuar no jogo e às vezes quita (desconecta). Deixando a partida um pouco mais difícil. Mas jogando sozinho online, a experiência também será muito bom para jogar. Em relação aos killers, o tempo de jogo; conhecimento dos personagens; mapas e melhorias de personagens, ficará mais fácil de se jogar com os killers. O balanceamento do game não é muito bom. Alguns jogadores killers, preferem (marcar caixão) marcar o ponto no gancho até o sobrevivente morrer, esta tática é velha e novata para alguns killers. Neste caso, é ter a paciência no game e procurar a melhor tática possível para jogar e ajudar o sobrevivente. Alguns killers são OP (Muito Apelões) que às vezes fica difícil de jogar contra o killer, e fica difícil fugir com o sobrevivente. Por este motivo, jogar este game tem que gostar de desafios, independentemente das suas escolhas de sobrevivente ou killer.
